main_definition: To retain, maintain or continue to have possession of something.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To hold onto an item and not give it away or discard it.
meanings_and_examples.example: She keeps her grandmother's antique necklace.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Continuing to perform a task or responsibility despite challenges.
meanings_and_examples.example: He keeps working on his novel, even when he feels uninspired.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Maintaining an aspect of oneself, such as personality traits or habits.
meanings_and_examples.example: She has kept her sense of humor throughout the years.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To be in a relationship and not end it. Usually used to describe romantic partners.
meanings_and_examples.example: They keep each other warm on cold winter nights.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Storing something, typically food, for later use.
meanings_and_examples.example: She keeps canned goods in the pantry for emergencies.
